# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is the Julia code that accomplishes this:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```

This function works by first converting `col` to lower case with the `lowercase()` function, then stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip()`. The regular expression `r"[\s-]"` matches any whitespace character (`\s`) and hyphens. The `replace()` function replaces these characters with underscores.

When you run `clean_column("My Column")`, it will return "my_column".
